newsitem.title: UK: ICI, BOC down as Capel cuts forecasts.
newsitem.headline: ICI, BOC down as Capel cuts forecasts.

text.p: Shares in Imperial Chemical Industries Plc and BOC Group Plc fell on Thursday after analysts at HSBC James Capel cut profit forecasts for the chemicals sector due to the strength of sterling, dealers said.
By 1033 GMT ICI had dropped 17p to 748 while BOC was down 13-1/2p at 884. Courtaulds Plc was two pence weaker at 391-1/2.
"We've moved all our sector forecasts to take account of the appreciation of sterling," Capel analyst David Ingles said. "The average downgrade was around 4.5 percent."
Ingles said he had cut profit forecasts for ICI by 100 million pounds for both 1997 and 1998. He cut BOC forecasts by around 15 million and Courtaulds forecasts by 10 million for the next two years.
"We've also adjusted our forecasts for the smaller companies in the sector," he said.
